entry.content:
Who

I am a Chamar boy, born in a somewhat normal middle class (not Chamar middle class, normal middle class) family.

My father had a Bajaj super in 1990, and we got a telephone in 1997.

I was born in 1982 in a semi-urban village in Delhi.

I know its hard to imagine a 'village" in Delhi now, but in 1990 till the time we stayed there, it had a well, we had cows and cow dung was the primary fuel though my father got us LPG ever since i can remember.

So now here we are. Year is 2020, chaos year of my generation, but somehow i am better placed then i ever was.

I have a spacious (in most senses) house, 2 cars, 2 dogs, a beautiful and intelligent son and mostly loving wife.

And I work at Facebook.

That is the big reveal. 2cr.

That declaration is not an achievement, I just want my readers to know what they have here. I am just getting started, and I have a long way to go.

This Facebook thing is important to me at-least as ever since i have realized what Chamar is, and how apparently things have being laid out for us - in sarkari sphere.

WHY

As I am getting older, I do tend to think about the past, mostly to learn from it. I remember those days, when my self worth was negative million.

I was targeted, gas lit at college, did not take it well, slipped in a depression, developed psiorisis, spent years in an sham ayurvedic ashram with skin swollen like a balloon filled with pus, abandonment by the girl I loved, the girl who loved me, friends, my own family, failed suicide attempt, living thru vengeance, death of father, a sister which destroyed the family, destroyed my existence to grab hers.

All because I am a Chamar.

It was not all bad, I somehow realized strengths which I thought I never had, and did generally well. Something kept me pushing, and I kept breathing.

I want to share my journey with you, so anyone who feels like i did in my Chamar years can get some semblance of hope or direction and hopefully he/she does not commit the grave mistakes I did, or felt like how I felt.

To Readers:

I hope you get a balanced view of a Chamar life and hopefully next time you feel like feeling taller, maybe you will spare the the sc/st clan in your class, office or school. And you have the full freedom to give me a piece of your mind, absolutely brutally.

I have designed the blog in a way that anonymous are welcome and give me their best shot. Its sort of a fuel to me now.

To my fellow chamaar/sc/st readers

I hope you learn.

I hope you feel hopeful.

I hope you can believe in yourself, than what you classmates are telling you silently.

I hope if my journey can benefit any 1 of you, my efforts would make sense to me.

HOW

I will try to narrate it in a novel kinda style. You already know where I am. Logically my story starts in class 11, when I started realizing the implications of being a chamaar meant, for career, for being friends with girls and home.
